title: Census of the Returned Exiles
summary: After the wall is completed, Nehemiah appoints leaders and guards. A census is taken, listing the families of those who returned from exile. This connects the present community to Godâ€™s covenant people.

faq.question: Why is the census important?
faq.answer: It confirms the identity and continuity of the people of God who returned from exile.

faq.question: What does this chapter show about leadership?
faq.answer: Nehemiah ensured security and structure by appointing trustworthy men.
